metadata.Title: CVE-2021-21311 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Adminer is an open-source database management in a single PHP file. In adminer from version 4.0.0 and before 4.7.9 there is a server-side request forgery vulnerability. Users of Adminer versions bundling all drivers (e.g. `adminer.php`) are affected. This is fixed in version 4.7.9.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-21311` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

adminer - 4.2.1-1ubuntu1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: adminer package in esm-apps/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.2.1-1ubuntu1+esm1').
